timeline.bodyText: I was a bit confused since the class names are the same. Is it possible to prefix one of them like we do with DbX models?
timeline.author: ericsong

replies.bodyText: Done. There was an issue with generating the model name prefix, which I've filed against Swagger, but it turns out by eliminating the Swagger oneOf (as I intended to do in a later PR), we can bypass this bug. swagger-api/swagger-codegen#10442
replies.author: calbach

timeline.author: ericsong

timeline.bodyText: Nit - some of the Runtime classes are prefixed with Leonardo while others are not. Is there a pattern being followed?
timeline.author: ericsong

replies.bodyText: I've basically added this prefix in contexts where it would not otherwise be obvious. Unfortunately "runtime" is a bit of a poor resource name, since it can commonly be used as an adjective or adverb. i.e. in this case, "RuntimeAuditor" could be interpreted in many different ways. In places where it's a noun in our own API, I just use "Runtime".
replies.author: calbach

timeline.message: Finally compiles, tests definitely broken, need to add new methods too
manage clusters fix, creation time fix
